results.title: Crete: the island in history. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The relation of Crete to trade routes and centres of the ancient world is considered. The history of Crete is briefly traced, indicating the various empires which at times have occupied the island. These include: the Macedonian empire, the Roman empire, the Byzantine empire, the Saracens, the Venetians, the Ottoman empire, Greece and the German military occupation.

results.title: Crete: the island and it's people. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Characteristic activities in a small village are shown; grinding of corn, farming, irrigation, hand reaping and threshing, growing of oranges, shearing and spinning wool, pottery making using the wheel, market day activities, ploughing with a primitive plough.

results.title: Crete: an introduction to an island. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Diagrams and models illustrate the geography, topography and brief geological history of the island. Subject-matter covered includes: transport on the island; water supply for irrigation; typical scenery in Western Crete; variations in climatic conditions throughout the island; agricultural pursuits; soil erosion resulting from excessive removal of trees for firewood; declining soil fertility of the land.

results.title: Creatures in clay: ceramic sculpture by Rosemary Wren
results.creator_credit: Films for Potters and J M Anderson Films
results.brief_description: This film about pottery shows in some detail, Rosemary Wren’s technique of building large figures, using T-shaped coils, and making small models by thumbing and pinching.

results.title: Creativity at school
results.brief_description: High school students learn to think creatively in a Technical Activities Centre where they apply what they have learned to model building projects. An experiment in science education at Sevenoaks School in Kent; boys apply the principals learned to creating a variety of models, instruments and machines including wireless controlled model boats and racing cars, an instrument to give blind people signals about their physical environment and a simple computer. The nature of this experiment makes this film an important educational record.

results.title: Creating space
results.creator_credit: Peter Lauterman, Angelo Stea and Gatineau
results.brief_description: An Artist commune in Toronto for painters, weavers, sculptors, photographers and architects, operating on a co-operative basic with the artists sharing living space and sharing ideas. Narrated by Peggy Graham.

results.title: Creating a dance (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The first part of the film traces stages in the creation of a demonstration of dance movement, examining the constituent parts and illustrating how the solutions to some of the associated problems were evolved. The second part presents the entire demonstration without comment. Dance direction and narration by Valerie Preston-Dunlop.
results.description: The first part of the film traces stages in the creation of a demonstration of dance movement, examining the constituent parts and illustrating how the solutions to some of the associated problems were evolved. The second part presents the entire demonstration without comment. Dance direction and narration by Valerie Preston-Dunlop.

results.title: Crayfish for Julie
results.brief_description: Depicts a day in the life of a fisherman catching crayfish off the coast near Fremantle, Western Australia. Briefly traces the growth and development of the crayfish industry. Made with the co operation of the Department of Fisheries Western Australia. Narrated by Clive Winmill.

results.title: Coventry Cathedral construction and consecration
results.brief_description: The building, embellishment and consecration of the new Cathedral Church of St. Michael at Coventry, from the preliminary earth moving in 1955 to completion seven years later, finishing with a tour of the completed cathedral, and the Consecration Ceremony attended by Her Majesty the Queen. Illuminates the contrasting skills which contributed to this achievement, and pays tribute to the architects, builders, engineers, artists and craftsmen who worked in stone and wood, glass, metal and tapestry.

results.title: Coventry and Ottobeuren join hands
results.creator_credit: F I B Dr W Lutje
results.brief_description: In 1964 the Benedictine monastery of Ottobeuren in Bavaria, celebrated its 12th centenary. Taking part in the celebrations was Princess Marina, Duchess of Kent, a manifestation of the cultural ties between Great Britain and Germany.
